verses.kjv: And king Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
verses.web: Zedekiah the son of Josiah reigned as king, instead of Coniah the son of Jehoiakim, whom Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon made king in the land of Judah.
verses.ct: Zedekiah son of Josiah became king in place of Coniah son of Jehoiakim. Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon had appointed Zedekiah to rule over the land of Judah.

verses.kjv: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, did hearken unto the words of the LORD, which he spake by the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.web: But neither he, nor his servants, nor the people of the land, listened to LORD’s words, which he spoke by the prophet Jeremiah.
verses.ct: But neither Zedekiah, nor his officials, nor the people of the land listened to the words the LORD spoke through the prophet Jeremiah.

verses.kjv: And Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah the priest to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, Pray now unto the LORD our God for us.
verses.web: Zedekiah the king sent Jehucal the son of Shelemiah, and Zephaniah the son of Maaseiah, the priest, to the prophet Jeremiah, saying, “Pray now to LORD our God for us.”
verses.ct: King Zedekiah sent Jehucal son of Shelemiah and the priest Zephaniah son of Maaseiah to the prophet Jeremiah with this message: "Please pray to the LORD our God for us."

verses.kjv: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people: for they had not put him into prison.
verses.web: Now Jeremiah came in and went out among the people; for they had not put him into prison.
verses.ct: At that time, Jeremiah was still free to move among the people, since he had not yet been thrown in prison.

verses.kjv: Then Pharaoh’s army was come forth out of Egypt: and when the Chaldeans that besieged Jerusalem heard tidings of them, they departed from Jerusalem.
verses.web: Pharaoh’s army had come out of Egypt; and when the Chaldeans who were besieging Jerusalem heard news of them, they broke up from Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Pharaoh's army had marched out of Egypt. When the Chaldeans besieging Jerusalem heard this news, they pulled back from the city.

verses.kjv: Then came the word of the LORD unto the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.web: Then LORD’s word came to the prophet Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the word of the LORD came to the prophet Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel; Thus shall ye say to the king of Judah, that sent you unto me to enquire of me; Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which is come forth to help you, shall return to Egypt into their own land.
verses.web: “LORD, the God of Israel, says, ‘You shall tell the king of Judah, who sent you to me to inquire of me: “Behold, Pharaoh’s army, which has come out to help you, will return to Egypt into their own land.
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'Tell the king of Judah, who sent you to ask me for answers: Pharaoh's army that marched out to help you is going to turn around and go back to Egypt.

verses.kjv: And the Chaldeans shall come again, and fight against this city, and take it, and burn it with fire.
verses.web: The Chaldeans will come again, and fight against this city. They will take it and burn it with fire.” ’
verses.ct: Then the Chaldeans will return. They will attack this city, capture it, and burn it to the ground.'

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Deceive not yourselves, saying, The Chaldeans shall surely depart from us: for they shall not depart.
verses.web: “LORD says, ‘Don’t deceive yourselves, saying, “The Chaldeans will surely depart from us;” for they will not depart.
verses.ct: "The LORD also says: 'Don't fool yourselves into thinking the Chaldeans are gone for good. They are not leaving.

verses.kjv: For though ye had smitten the whole army of the Chaldeans that fight against you, and there remained but wounded men among them, yet should they rise up every man in his tent, and burn this city with fire.
verses.web: For though you had struck the whole army of the Chaldeans who fight against you, and only wounded men remained among them, they would each rise up in his tent and burn this city with fire.’ ”
verses.ct: Even if you defeated the entire Chaldean army fighting against you and only wounded survivors were left lying in their tents, those men would still get up and burn this city with fire.'"

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that when the army of the Chaldeans was broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.web: When the army of the Chaldeans had broken up from Jerusalem for fear of Pharaoh’s army,
verses.ct: When the Chaldean army pulled back from Jerusalem because of Pharaoh's approaching forces,

verses.kjv: Then Jeremiah went forth out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to separate himself thence in the midst of the people.
verses.web: then Jeremiah went out of Jerusalem to go into the land of Benjamin, to receive his portion there, in the middle of the people.
verses.ct: Jeremiah left Jerusalem to travel to the territory of Benjamin to claim his share of property there among the people.

verses.kjv: And when he was in the gate of Benjamin, a captain of the ward was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he took Jeremiah the prophet, saying, Thou fallest away to the Chaldeans.
verses.web: When he was in Benjamin’s gate, a captain of the guard was there, whose name was Irijah, the son of Shelemiah, the son of Hananiah; and he seized Jeremiah the prophet, saying, “You are defecting to the Chaldeans!”
verses.ct: But when he reached the Gate of Benjamin, a guard captain named Irijah son of Shelemiah, son of Hananiah, seized the prophet Jeremiah and accused him: "You're deserting to the Chaldeans!"

verses.kjv: Then said Jeremiah, It is false; I fall not away to the Chaldeans. But he hearkened not to him: so Irijah took Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.
verses.web: Then Jeremiah said, “That is false! I am not defecting to the Chaldeans.” But he didn’t listen to him; so Irijah seized Jeremiah, and brought him to the princes.
verses.ct: Jeremiah protested, "That's a lie! I'm not deserting to the Chaldeans!" But Irijah refused to listen. He arrested Jeremiah and dragged him before the officials.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the princes were wroth with Jeremiah, and smote him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe: for they had made that the prison.
verses.web: The princes were angry with Jeremiah, and struck him, and put him in prison in the house of Jonathan the scribe; for they had made that the prison.
verses.ct: The officials were furious with Jeremiah. They had him beaten and locked up in the house of Jonathan the scribe, which had been converted into a prison.

verses.kjv: When Jeremiah was entered into the dungeon, and into the cabins, and Jeremiah had remained there many days;
verses.web: When Jeremiah had come into the dungeon house, and into the cells, and Jeremiah had remained there many days,
verses.ct: Jeremiah was thrown into an underground dungeon with vaulted cells, and he remained there for a long time.

verses.kjv: Then Zedekiah the king sent, and took him out: and the king asked him secretly in his house, and said, Is there any word from the LORD? And Jeremiah said, There is: for, said he, thou shalt be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.
verses.web: then Zedekiah the king sent, and had him brought out. The king asked him secretly in his house, “Is there any word from LORD?” Jeremiah said, “There is.” He also said, “You will be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon.”
verses.ct: Then King Zedekiah sent for him and had him brought to the palace. In private, the king asked, "Is there any word from the LORD?" Jeremiah answered, "There is. You will be handed over to the king of Babylon."

verses.kjv: Moreover Jeremiah said unto king Zedekiah, What have I offended against thee, or against thy servants, or against this people, that ye have put me in prison?
verses.web: Moreover Jeremiah said to king Zedekiah, “How have I sinned against you, against your servants, or against this people, that you have put me in prison?
verses.ct: Then Jeremiah said to King Zedekiah, "What crime have I committed against you, your officials, or this people that you've thrown me in prison?

verses.kjv: Where are now your prophets which prophesied unto you, saying, The king of Babylon shall not come against you, nor against this land?
verses.web: Now where are your prophets who prophesied to you, saying, ‘The king of Babylon will not come against you, nor against this land?’
verses.ct: And where are those prophets of yours who told you, 'The king of Babylon won't attack you or this land'?

verses.kjv: Therefore hear now, I pray thee, O my lord the king: let my supplication, I pray thee, be accepted before thee; that thou cause me not to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.
verses.web: Now please hear, my lord the king: please let my supplication be presented before you, that you not cause me to return to the house of Jonathan the scribe, lest I die there.”
verses.ct: Please listen to me, my lord the king. I'm begging you — don't send me back to the house of Jonathan the scribe. I'll die if you send me there."

verses.kjv: Then Zedekiah the king commanded that they should commit Jeremiah into the court of the prison, and that they should give him daily a piece of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city were spent. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the prison.
verses.web: Then Zedekiah the king commanded, and they committed Jeremiah into the court of the guard. They gave him daily a loaf of bread out of the bakers’ street, until all the bread in the city was gone. Thus Jeremiah remained in the court of the guard.
verses.ct: So King Zedekiah gave orders to have Jeremiah transferred to the courtyard of the guard. He also commanded that Jeremiah be given a loaf of bread each day from the bakers' street, until all the bread in the city ran out. And so Jeremiah remained in the courtyard of the guard.
